title: Über uns
text:
Dies ist der offizielle Blog des MethodenKompetenzZentrums der TU Chemnitz
Hier folgt eine Vorstellung des MKZ und des Inhalts des Blogs

title: HowToBlog #1: setup work environment
text:
#1 Software


You will need:

git (https://git-scm.com/downloads)
R (https://cran.r-project.org/)
RStudio (https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/)<
RTools (https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/Rtools/)
Quarto (https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/)

download and install software. If you already have some of it, then make sure everything is the latest version.
When using Windows, install RStudio and RTools to C:\
(default path: C:\program files\ may cause errors)







#2 Config Github & RStudio


in github:


> > - get invited to organisation and accept
in RStudio:

install needed packages
create new Project

use version control and git
paste git directory

set git name, email in terminal:

git config –global user.email “your Email”
git config –global user.name “Your Name”
(omit “–global” to set only for current project

create pat in github, copy pat_string (save somewhere, because you can’t see it in github later
set PAT: in console: gitcreds::gitcreds_set(), than insert pat string

title: HowToBlog #2: publish new post
text:
#1 create Files



go to posts directory, create new folder, name it unique
->New Blank File -> Quarto Doc… -> index.qmd








#2 add Metadata



add metadata block to file begin
block begins and ends with “—”



---
title: "titel"\
description: "description" author: "author"\
date: "2024-01-11"\
categories: \[HowToBlog\]\
doi: xx.xxxx/xxxxxx\
freeze: true
---




#3 add content



add content as you wish RStudio provides various options to format your input, for more detailed information to quarto look here: https://quarto.org/docs/guide/
add additional files and images in post directory as needed
to preview output: save all files then Render Website








#4 publish



check only your post directory and its content
write meaningful commit message for version control
click commit, if success then close commit window
